result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanetrise C Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay costs and DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restiutution is set at $0.
- No Contact with firearms. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatent including random urine screens.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programms as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, calendar successor, for review. mag
Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation received and forwarded to June S. os

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.
Scanned: State Subpoena.
Scanned:  State Subpoena.

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 5-13-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 40.
- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.   All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON enhancer is deleted:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in.  Case is adjourned to 2-2-2016 for sentencing.  Trial date is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 1-6-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 2-3-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shanetrise C Brown in court with Attorney Dana L. Gimbel.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel enters motion to withdraw and informs Court that defendant has made statements to her that she may not pay counsel fees.
State informs Court they are ready to proceed to trial on today's date.
Court grants motion to withdraw and orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 38.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.
